edu.harvard.hms.dbmi.bd2k.irct.action

Interface Action

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JoinAction, ProcessAction, QueryAction

    public interface Action
    The action interface provides a set of basic functionality that all actions must accomplish. An action can be a Join, Query, Process or other. Each action subtype having their own interface that should be used.
    Author:
    Jeremy R. Easton-Marks

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Result getResults(SecureSession secureSession)
      Returns the results from an action

      Returns the actions status

      Run the given action in a secure session if required

    • Method Detail

      • run

        void run(SecureSession secureSession)
  throws ResourceInterfaceException
        Run the given action in a secure session if required
        Parameters:
        secureSession - A secure session (Null if not needed or set)
        Throws:
        ResourceInterfaceException - A resource interface exception occurred

      • updateActionParams

        void updateActionParams(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Result> updatedParams)
        Updates the parameters of the action with the new information. This is typically used in chained actions.
        Parameters:
        updatedParams - Updated parameters of an action
